Licensing Users Using Borland License Server

Once you have downloaded all of the .zip files containing the .slip files per the instructions provided on the web, copy each concurrent_.slip and/or named_.slp file into your License directory (C:\Program Files\Borland\StarTeam Server\License). Copy each server_.slip file to (C:\Borland\BLS4\conf).

The following procedures explain how to assign licenses to specific users. Once the slips have been placed in the /license folder, User Manager can display information about the slips and an administrator can assign licenses from those slips to users.  

To assign licenses to existing users:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged on, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

      • These actions display the User Manager dialog.

  4. Select one or more users.

  5. Right-click to display the context menu and select Assign License to display a list of the licenses that can be assigned. The license types are:

    • StarTeam named user licenses. This is the same as named user licenses in earlier StarTeam releases.

    • StarTeam concurrent user licenses. This is the same as concurrent user licenses in earlier StarTeam releases.

    • Unassigned. Select this “license type” when a user has no license.

     To assign a license to a new user:

  1. From the User Manager dialog, select the New User button. The New User Properties dialog opens.

  2. On the General tab, select a license type from the License drop-down list box. The default is StarTeam Concurrent.

  3. Enter the rest of the data on the General and other tabs as appropriate. Remember to use the network logon name for the User Name text box on the Logon tab.

  4. Click OK to exit the New User Properties dialog box.

Notes:

  • The status line at the bottom of the User Manager dialog provides licensing statistics.

  • You may need to edit the properties for the user to change the user name to the network logon name.
